msContents.summary: Register for payment of the syntaximon; entries are recorded daily and list name, patronymic and amount paid

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; text on the back published as P.Princ. 11
Seven columns: col. I, 8 lines; col. II, 2 lines; col. III, 32 lines; col. IV, 28(?) lines; col. V, 37 lines; col. VI, 30 lines; col. VII, 31 lines;
Columns I-IV greatly damaged and effaced; some effacement to the remaining columns; very many holes
This papyrus joins with P. Corn. 21: col. IV of P.Princ. 2 is the top portion of col. I of P.Corn. 21 and col. VII of P.Princ. 2 is the top portion of col. II of P.Corn. 21
The hand is a small, rapid cursive; same hand as P.Princ. 1, 3-6 and P. Corn. 21

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: [col. II] Akousilas s. of Akousilas, 24 1/2 ob. 2 chalki, 1 dr. 1 ob.; Tryphon s. of Tryphon, priest, 4; [col.
